result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine C Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Attended Vehicle, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Sign up for probation no later than 10/14/22.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample by 10/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay a fine of $300.00.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

No contact with A.G.R.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No firearms.
No prescription drugs without a valid presription.
AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine C Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jermaine C Wilson in court.  Attorney Tyler David Rasmussen in court for Jermaine C Wilson.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case 
for the purpose of sentencing. 
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Court finds victim notification has been complied with.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS concurrent in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/14/22.
- Pay a fine of $300.00.
- No contact with AGR
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Complete 16 hours of community service.
- No firearms.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/14/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm

At the request of the defense, the 9/08/22 status conference is vacated and matter set for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Defendant's Request for Adjournment, filed.  rmm

Defendant Jermaine C Wilson in court with attorney Tyler David Rasmussen.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Rasmussen has received discovery but not an offer and requests another status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jermaine C Wilson in court with attorney Tyler David Rasmussen who appeared via Zoom.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Rasmussen was just retained and has not received discovery.  Atty. Rasmussen requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 056192,
Payable Number: 1013534,
Receipt Number: 22RP024210,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Jermaine C Wilson in court.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Matter set for pretrial conference.  Defendant is not qualified for a SPD and he informed the Court he has retained counsel and would like another date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Jermaine C Wilson in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
